title: Senior Benefits Analyst (EMEA & APAC)
content:
About the Role
As a senior Benefits Analyst (for the EMEA and APAC regions) you will work with the Total Rewards team to help manage the benefits and Leave of Absence processes and elevate the employee experience. The role will involve managing core employee queries on benefits and leave programs, vendor liaison and renewal and contract review for benefits programs globally and will report to Senior Global Benefits Manager.
You will be confident operating independently and be comfortable in challenging the status quo, to work toward more efficient processes, working with partners and stakeholders to build efficient, scalable processes that result in an exceptional employee experience.
What you will be doing:

First point of contact for all employees to provide a smooth employee experience on the various benefits and leave programs.
Maintain employee leave data in Workday (HRIS system).
Provide guidance to regional stakeholders such as HRBPs, operations and payroll team on administering various leave programs.
Administer paperwork with the local government to ensure that the employer notifications are up to date in government portals.
Work closely with the payroll team on top-up pay calculations on various leave programs.
Review and update leave policies in adherence to statutory regulations.
Create and maintain process documents on the leave processes.
Provide data on market trends and enhancements that can be offered.
Maintain and manage employee well-being programs and webinars.
Answer questions related to company policies, guidelines and processes.
Invoice review and reconciliation
Engage with Finance and Accounts Payable teams to set up vendors and ensure that processes are maintained
Troubleshoot issues in Workday and escalate to the HRIS team as needed.
Lead renewal strategies and paperwork for EMEA and APAC entities.
Support the setup of new countries (contracts, partner, benefits)

 
Minimum Requirements:

Multi-years of experience in global benefits in an international environment, supporting both EMEA and APAC
Demonstrated benefits administration experience including knowledge of health and welfare plans, leaves, time off practices, and retirement plans
Experience managing leave processes globally
Initiative to perform most tasks with little instructions on daily tasks and general instructions for newly introduced assignments
Ability to manage multiple tasks independently in a fast-paced environment
Extremely detailed oriented with high standards for accuracy and ability to handle sensitive data with confidentiality
Foundational knowledge in Excel and spreadsheet proficiency
Team player to work collaboratively across teams in EMEA, APAC and in the US
Strong verbal and written communication skills to communicate to all employees accurately and professionally
Ability to navigate ambiguity

#LI-REMOTEAbout 10x Genomics
At 10x Genomics, accelerating our understanding of biology is more than a mission for us. It is a commitment. This is the century of biology, and the breakthroughs we make now have the potential to change the world.We enable scientists to advance their research, allowing them to address scientific questions they did not even know they could ask. Our tools have enabled fundamental discoveries across biology including cancer, immunology, and neuroscience.Our teams are empowered and encouraged to follow their passions, pursue new ideas, and perform at their best in an inclusive and dynamic environment. We know that behind every scientific breakthrough, there is a deep infrastructure of talented people driving the life sciences industry and making it possible for scientists and clinicians to make new strides. We are dedicated to finding the very best person for every aspect of our work because the innovations and discoveries that we enable together will lead to better technologies, better treatments, and a better future. Find out how you can make a 10x difference.
